text: today's recipe is fairly even a recipe
but I think you guys deserve to know how
to make this great thing it's roasted
cabbage wedges super simple and really
really stunning when it's done take one
head of cabbage cut it into 1-inch
slices leaving the core intact because
that's going to hold everything together
so be careful because it gets a little
unwieldy when you're cutting cabbage on
its side drizzle a baking sheet with
olive oil about a tablespoon place the
cabbage on the sheet pan I like to sort
of rub it in the oil and then turn it
over and then you're going to drizzle
with another two tablespoons so be
generous with the oil it's going to
absorb a lot of oil and since it's such
a simple recipe you really want it to
have plenty of flavor seasoned with salt
and pepper I have my oven preheating to
400 degrees so it's a pretty hot oven
not SuperDuper hot because you want it
to get golden brown in places but still
cook through before it starts to charge
you much so a 400 degree oven is perfect
for something that's dense like this and
then for flavor you can sprinkle it with
either a teaspoon of caraway or teaspoon
of fennel seeds which is what I'm using
both of those would be really really
nice great complementary flavors to the
cabbage so you just get this into your
400 degree preheated oven and cook it
until it's tender and sort of browned in
spots that'll take about 40 to 45
minutes
aren't those beautiful they look like
little flowers don't they
super stunning super simple super
delicious
enjoy
